block.p: Jane Fairbanks Watson, a daughter of Susan Watson and Russell E. Watson III of Irvington, N.Y., was married there yesterday to William Shedd Glassmeyer, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward F. Glassmeyer of Darien, Conn. The Rev. Dr. Charles R. Colwell performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of St. Barnabas.

Mrs. Glassmeyer, 28, teaches the second grade at the Horace Mann School in Riverdale, the Bronx. She graduated from Denison University and received a master's degree in education from Lesley College. Her father is a senior editor at Newsweek magazine in New York. Her mother retired as the owner of the Sunnyside Flower Shop in Irvington.

Jane Fairbanks Watson, a daughter of Susan Watson and Russell E. Watson III of Irvington, N.Y., was married there yesterday to William Shedd Glassmeyer, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward F. Glassmeyer of Darien, Conn. The Rev. Dr. Charles R. Colwell performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of St. Barnabas.

Mrs. Glassmeyer, 28, teaches the second grade at the Horace Mann School in Riverdale, the Bronx. She graduated from Denison University and received a master's degree in education from Lesley College. Her father is a senior editor at Newsweek magazine in New York. Her mother retired as the owner of the Sunnyside Flower Shop in Irvington.

Mr. Glassmeyer, also 28, is known as Shedd. He is the director of business strategy at Bulldogresearch .com, a New York-based Web site, which evaluates financial analysts. He graduated from Colorado College. His mother, Penelope Glassmeyer, is a builder and contractor in Darien. His father is a general partner in Oak Investment Partners, a venture capital firm in Westport, Conn.
